definition: to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)

sentences.chinese: 它与上下文无关，并且毫不含糊。

sentences.english: Drunken people often have slurred speech.
sentences.chinese: 喝醉酒的人说话时经常含糊不清。

sentences.english: Sometimes really ambiguous entries make it on the list because I trust my future self way too much.
sentences.chinese: 有时，我写下含糊不清的条目，这是自视甚高。

sentences.english: Experience tells us that the answer is an unambiguous yes.
sentences.chinese: 经验告诉我们答案是可以，毫不含糊。

sentences.english: The Feng dance surely can't explain to do what, just unclearly said for a while.
sentences.chinese: 凤舞当然不会解释要做什么，只是含糊地说了一下。

sentences.english: Even the Chinese government hesitates to talk about censorship.
sentences.chinese: 即使中国政府谈及审查制度含糊其辞。

sentences.english: Vagueness makes it difficult to understand the meaning of a tag.
sentences.chinese: 含糊性使人们很难理解标签的含义。

sentences.english: He writes his letter with extreme simplicity and uses vague and indefinite expressions.
sentences.chinese: 他的信写得极为简单，表达含糊不清。

sentences.english: To talk or act insincerely or misleadingly; equivocate .
sentences.chinese: 支吾，搪塞不说真话，含糊其词。

sentences.english: His speech blurred the more he drank.
sentences.chinese: 他喝酒越多，他的话越含糊不清。

sentences.english: You would wrong him and wrong yourself by equivocation of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 你应该用含糊的语言来含糊他和你自己。

sentences.english: You would wrong him and wrong yourself by equivocation of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 你应该用含糊的语言来含糊他和你自己。

sentences.english: Ambiguity leads to mess and confusion.
For there are lots of mumbles such as promises.
sentences.chinese: 因为我有许多承诺之类含糊的话。

sentences.english: In my opinion the answer is an unequivocal “yes”.
sentences.chinese: 按我的意见，答案毫不含糊，是肯定的。

sentences.english: Further the government defines unlawful content in overbroad and vague terms.
sentences.chinese: 此外，政府对非法内容的界定过于宽泛和含糊。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
